title: Systems Automation Creator
description:
Automation Architect (Outsourced / Contract)

Build the operational backbone of a modern design-build and real estate company

We are seeking an experienced Automation Architect to design, build, and maintain scalable internal systems that support client onboarding, project management, and team communication. This is not a task-based automation role. It is a systems role focused on architecture, reliability, and long-term scalability.

This position is outsourced/contract-based, with the potential for ongoing work if the partnership proves successful.



Our Goal

I’m looking to be able to run 99% of our business from the speaking capabilities of ChatGPT. When I talk to my phone I need it to be able to look up information about a project (airtable),
 that information (google workspace) and attach documents (google drive) to individuals in my contact list or database among other things.  The primary goal goes back to conversational instruction and interaction.  

Role Overview

You will be responsible for architecting a fully integrated automation ecosystem that connects client intake, onboarding, project workflows, internal communication, and AI-assisted decision-making. The system will be orchestrated primarily through n8n, with Airtable, Google Workspace, and AI tools serving as core components.

You will work directly with leadership to translate business processes into durable, well-documented automation logic.



What You Will Be Responsible For

Designing end-to-end automation workflows that support sales, onboarding, and project execution

Translating real-world business processes into structured, state-based systems

Building readable, maintainable, and debuggable n8n workflows

Implementing AI thoughtfully and intentionally, with clear guardrails

Anticipating failure points and designing error handling, logging, and recovery paths

Producing clear documentation that allows systems to be maintained and extended



How and Why Someone Succeeds in This Role

Success in this role requires the ability to move from ambiguity to structure. You will be working with evolving processes, multiple business lines, and real human constraints.

You will do well if you:

Think in systems, states, and workflows

Can clearly articulate why a solution is designed a certain way

View automation as an evolving product, not a one-time build

Balance technical rigor with business practicality

Are comfortable designing for both scale and human intervention



Required Traits

Strong systems thinking and architectural judgment

High attention to edge cases and failure scenarios

Clear, concise written communication

Comfort pushing back on poor assumptions with better alternatives

Methodical problem-solving under real-world constraints



Required Experience and Software Mastery

Candidates must demonstrate real-world proficiency with the following:

Core Stack

n8n – workflow orchestration, branching logic, webhooks, error handling

Airtable – relational data modeling, views as logic layers, record state management

Google Workspace

Google Docs for contracts, scopes, and generated documentation

Google Sheets for structured data and logs

Google Drive for automated folder and file creation

Gmail and Calendar for automated communication and scheduling

AI Utilization (Intentional and Selective)

ChatGPT

Client-facing conversational logic

Summarization and structured output

Front-end response generation

Gemini

Advanced reasoning and multi-step analysis

Complex decision evaluation when deeper logic is required

A strong candidate understands when not to use AI just as clearly as when to use it.



Current Client Onboarding and Project Management Workflow (High-Level)

The system you will be designing supports the following lifecycle:

1. Client Intake

Client submits an intake form via website, referral, or agent

Data is normalized and stored in Airtable

Client is assigned an initial status (Lead, Qualified, Onboarding)

2. Qualification and Routing

AI reviews intake data for project type, budget alignment, and timeline feasibility

Client is routed to the appropriate service path:

Design-only

Design and construction

Real estate support

Internal stakeholders receive an AI-generated summary

3. Automated Onboarding

Welcome communication and next-step instructions are sent

Contracts are generated in Google Docs

Deposits and key milestones are logged

Project-specific folder structures are created in Google Drive

Project status moves to Active

4. Project Management Execution

Projects progress through defined phases:

Discovery

Design

Selections

Procurement

Construction

Close-out

Status changes trigger:

Internal tasks

Client updates

Document creation

AI-generated summaries for handoffs

5. Intelligence and Oversight Layer

ChatGPT is used for:

Client-facing summaries

Meeting recaps

Scope explanations

Gemini is used for:

Conflict detection

Timeline and dependency risk analysis

Validation of complex decisions



Application Requirement (Primary Evaluation Criteria)

To be considered, applicants must submit a one-page pitch that includes:

1. Executive Summary

Your approach to building this system

Your philosophy on automation architecture

How you design for reliability and scale

2. Workflow Diagram

A clear visual diagram showing:

Triggers and entry points

Data storage and state transitions

n8n workflow structure

AI decision points

Diagram tools may include Figma, L
 Whimsical, Miro, or similar

3. Risks and Concerns

Where complexity is most likely to arise

What components are most fragile

Where human intervention is required

4. Proposed Solutions

Error handling and recovery strategies

Logging and monitoring approaches

Versioning and extensibility considerations

This submission will be the primary basis for selection. Process clarity and architectural thinking matter more than credentials.



Engagement Details

Outsourced / contract engagement

Compensation structured by phase or milestone

Potential for long-term partnership

Direct access to decision-makers



This role is designed for someone who values clarity, structure, and durable systems.

If you approach automation as architecture rather than scripting, this position will be a strong fit.



If you’d like, next steps could include:

A shorter public-facing version for LinkedIn or Upwork

A scoring rubric for evaluating submissions

A sample “excellent” workflow diagram outline for internal reference

title: Video Editor - Regenerative Agriculture Brand (Part-Time, Long-Term)
description:
About Grass Roots Farmers' Cooperative



We're on a mission to rebuild trust in our food system. Grass Roots Farmers' Cooperative is a regenerative agriculture e-commerce company that connects conscious consumers with pasture-raised meats from small-scale family farms across America. We deliver premium quality food while telling the authentic stories of the people who produce it.



This isn't just another food brand - we're fighting against industrial agriculture and helping people understand where their food truly comes from. We are starting on a new path for organic social media content strategy. Everything you see on our accounts is about to change. We will be creating content that educates, inspires, and builds trust through transparency, not gimmicks.



The Role

We're looking for a talented video editor who shares our passion for sustainable food systems and authentic storytelling. You'll be the creative force behind content that showcases real farmers, real farms, and real food - helping consumers make better choices for their health, their communities, and the planet.



You'll create content for both our brand channels and our CEO's personal platform, where he's building authority as a trusted voice in food systems and regenerative agriculture.



This is a part-time, ongoing position with growth potential for the right person.



What You'll Be Editing



3-5 short-form videos per week (approximately 60 seconds each) for YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels, TikTok,
, and LinkedIn

1 long-form video per month (10-30 minutes) for YouTube



Content Types Include:



Farmer testimonials and interviews

Behind-the-scenes farm tours

Food reviews and product showcases

Educational content explaining regenerative agriculture practices

Customer stories and experiences

Thought leadership content for CEO's personal brand



What Success Looks Like

You'll receive raw footage, voiceover audio, and creative direction from our Marketing Content Director. Your job is to craft compelling stories using advanced video and sound editing techniques that make people care about where their food comes from. This is authentic, educational content - not mindless entertainment. We value substance, clarity, and emotional connection.



Required Skills & Experience

Must-Haves:



Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro (this is non-negotiable)

Very fast, reliable internet connection for receiving/sending large video files

Strong ability to identify and improve poor audio quality

Ability to select the right music for the right scene

Portfolio demonstrating clean cuts, good pacing, and storytelling ability

Excellent English proficiency (written and verbal)

Ability to follow detailed creative direction while knowing when to apply creative freedom

Professional communication skills and responsiveness

Openness to multiple rounds of revisions and incorporating team feedback



Strongly Preferred:



Color grading skills (farm footage shot in various lighting conditions)

Motion graphics and text animation capabilities

Thumbnail design and photo editing skills

Background or genuine interest in food systems, agriculture, sustainability, or health



Bonus Skills (Additional Opportunities Available):



Script writing ability

Research skills for educational content

Social media content strategy knowledge



Working Relationship & Expectations



You'll report directly to our Marketing Content Director and collaborate with our creative team

Turnaround times:



Short-form videos: 48 hours for first draft, 24 hours for revisions

Long-form videos: 5 days for first cut





You'll need to be available occasionally for video conference calls during US Central Standard Time (CST) business hours

Asynchronous work is fine, but timely communication and meeting deadlines is essential

This is a collaborative process - expect feedback from our strategy team and multiple editing rounds



What You'll Need to Provide

When editing our content, you'll work with:



Raw footage we provide from farm visits, interviews, and product shoots

Voiceover audio files

Creative briefs and direction

You'll also source additional assets as needed (stock footage, B-roll, music, graphics)



Compensation



$10-15 per hour depending on experience and skill level

We're also open to discussing alternative compensation structures such as per-project rates or monthly retainers for the right candidate

Part-time hours with potential to grow into more work as our content production scales



Application Process

We're looking for someone who actually reads job postings and follows directions (you'd be surprised how rare that is). Here's what we need from you:



Portfolio - Share links to your best work, especially:



Interview/testimonial videos

Short-form social content

Any food, agriculture, lifestyle, or educational content



Resume - Your editing experience and relevant background

Brief Introduction - In your own words, tell us:



Why you're interested in working with a regenerative agriculture brand

Which piece in your portfolio best represents the style we need

Your availability and preferred working arrangement



Important: Somewhere in your application message, please include the words PASTURE RAISED in all capital letters to show you've read this posting carefully. Applications without this will likely not be considered.

Selected applicants will be asked to complete a paid trial editing project using assets (video files and voiceover) that we provide. This helps us assess your technical skills, creative judgment, and ability to follow direction.



Why This Opportunity Matters

If you care about making a real difference through your work, this is your chance. The content you create will help families make better food choices, support small-scale farmers, and participate in healing our agricultural system.

You'll be part of a mission-driven team that values authenticity, quality, and transparency. This isn't about churning out viral content - it's about creating something meaningful that educates and inspires.



Ready to Apply?

If you're passionate about storytelling, have the technical skills we need, and want to be part of a movement toward better food systems, we want to hear from you.

Submit your portfolio, resume, and introduction today. We're excited to find the right partner for this journey.

title: Spécialiste Service Client (SAV) & VA — GelWaterGun — Full-Time 40h ($$$ + bonus)
description:
GelWaterGun est une marque e-commerce européenne de Gel Blasters / Pistolets à Orbeez, en forte croissance. Nous servons des clients en FR, EN, DE, ES, IT, NL, PL.

Nous cherchons un(e) VA orienté(e) Service Client (SAV) pour prendre en charge les demandes clients au quotidien, nous aider sur des tâches opérationnelles simples, et évoluer vers un rôle de Lead VA (management d’une petite équipe) si tout se passe bien.



Missions (priorité SAV GelWaterGun)



- Répondre aux e-mails SAV dans la langue du client (FR/EN en direct ; DE/ES/IT/NL/PL via outils de traduction avec relecture), en respectant notre SOP SAV GelWaterGun (ton, structure, signature, procédures).



- Délais & suivi colis : vérifier les trackings, relancer le transporteur si besoin, expliquer clairement les étapes (expédié, douanes, livré, non réclamé, etc.).



- Produits défectueux / pannes : demander photo/vidéo, rappeler les bonnes pratiques Orbeez (hydratation, taille des billes, batterie/LED…), proposer la solution adaptée (conseil, pièce, renvoi, remboursement partiel/intégral selon le cas).



- Pièces/notice manquantes : organiser l’envoi de l’accessoire ou partager une notice PDF, s’excuser et clôturer proprement.



- Retours & rétractations (14 jours) : appliquer notre procédure (validation préalable, photos, conditions d’état neuf/emballage, frais de retour, inspection et remboursement intégral/partiel).



- Livraisons erronées/volées : ouvrir une enquête transporteur, collecter preuves (photos lieu de livraison, voisinage, attestation sur l’honneur), proposer renvoi ou remboursement selon résultat.



- Précommandes / ruptures : informer des délais estimés, proposer alternatives (modèle/couleur) ou remboursement.



- Demandes B2B/pro : transférer immédiatement au fondateur.



- Qualité & amélioration continue : mettre à jour macros/FAQ, remonter les feedbacks clients, proposer des améliorations de process.



- Documentation interne légère : notes de cas, mini-captures Loom pour expliquer un process, mise à jour de la base de connaissances (Notion/Trello).



KPI (objectifs)



- 1ère réponse < 12h ouvrées, résolution < 48h quand possible.



- CSAT ? 4,6/5, clarté et courtoisie irréprochables.



- Traçabilité des dossiers sensibles (litiges transport, renvois, remboursements).



Outils



Shopify, Gmail, Google Drive/Docs/Sheets, Notion/Trello, Loom, outils de tracking (AfterShip/17Track), Klaviyo (lecture d’historique), ChatGPT/IA pour l’aide multi-langue (toujours relire).





Profil recherché :



- Excellente rédaction en français ; anglais écrit courant. À l’aise pour traiter DE/ES/IT/NL/PL avec IA + bon sens.



- Expérience SAV e-commerce (Shopify ou similaire) exigée.



- Rigueur, autonomie, sens du détail, esprit solution et priorisation.



- À l’aise avec procédures/SOP, demandes de preuves (photo/vidéo) et prise de décision selon le cas.



- Disponibilité en horaires Europe/Paris (4–6h de recouvrement quotidien minimum).



- Matériel fiable + connexion internet stable.





Ce que nous offrons :



- Full-time 40h/semaine (poste long terme, stable).



- Rémunération compétitive ($$$) + bonus performance/CSAT.



- Formation complète à nos SOP GelWaterGun + coaching régulier.



- Évolution possible vers Lead VA (coordination d’équipe, QA, reporting).



Comment postuler ?



Pour candidater, veuillez remplir notre formulaire ci-dessous : 







Nous vous recontacterons sous peu si votre profil nous intéresse afin de vous expliquer les prochaines étapes de ce processus de recrutement.

description:

Gérer des échanges principalement en français, mais aussi parfois en anglais, allemand, néerlandais, espagnol, polonais et italien (avec l'aide d'outils comme ChatGPT si besoin).

title: Remote Insurance Authorization & Benefits Specialist Physical Therapy
description:
Edge Physical Therapy is a rapidly growing outpatient physical therapy company specializing in one-on-one care, advanced diagnostics, and fast patient access. We are seeking an experienced Remote Insurance Authorization & Benefits Specialist to manage insurance eligibility, authorizations, and Plan of Care (POC) tracking to ensure patients are cleared, compliant, and billable.

This role directly impacts clinic revenue, provider compliance, and patient experience.

________________________________________

Position Summary

This position is responsible for verifying insurance eligibility, submitting and tracking prior authorizations, and managing all Plan of Care (POC) documentation between Edge Physical Therapy, referring physicians, and insurance companies.

You will ensure no patient is treated without financial and authorization clearance and that all documentation meets insurance and Medicare requirements.

This is a part-time, remote (20 hours/week) position requiring prior experience in insurance authorizations.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

Insurance Eligibility & Benefits

• Verify patient insurance coverage prior to evaluations and re-evaluations

• Confirm:

o Deductibles

o Co-pays

o Coinsurance

o Visit limits

o Authorization requirements

• Document all benefit information in the EMR and tracking spreadsheets

________________________________________

Prior Authorizations

• Submit authorization requests for:

o Physical therapy

o EMG/NCS

o Imaging and specialty services

• Track all requests in Excel

• Follow up daily with insurance companies until approved

• Resolve denials or missing documentation

• Notify clinic staff when patients are cleared

________________________________________

Plan of Care (POC) Management

• Fax completed  Plans of Care to referring physicians

• Track signed and unsigned POCs in Excel

• Receive and upload returned POCs into the EMR

• Ensure no POC expires or is missing

________________________________________

Fax & Documentation Handling

• Upload all POCs to the correct patient charts

• Forward all faxes to appropriate person

• Maintain organized records for audits and billing

________________________________________

Performance Standards & KPIs

This role is measured by speed, accuracy, and compliance:

1. Authorizations

• All authorizations must be submitted no later than the day after the patient’s visit

________________________________________

2. Eligibility

• All patient eligibility must be verified at least 3 days before each evaluation or re-evaluation

________________________________________

3. Plans of Care

• All POCs must be faxed out daily

• All sent POCs must be recorded in the appropriate Excel tracking sheet

• All returned POCs must be uploaded to the EMR

________________________________________

4. Missing Signatures

• All missing or unsigned POCs must be re-faxed weekly until returned

________________________________________

5. Compliance

• No patient should be treated without valid authorization and signed POC when required

________________________________________

Required Qualifications

• Prior experience in insurance verification and prior authorizations (required)

• Experience in physical therapy, rehab, or outpatient medical preferred

• Strong phone skills with insurance companies and physician offices

• Excellent time management and follow-up skills

• High attention to detail

• Proficient in Excel for tracking and reporting

• Comfortable working independently in a remote role

________________________________________

Why Work With Edge Physical Therapy

• Flexible remote schedule

• Stable 20-hour/week workload

• High accountability, high trust environment

• Be part of a growing, premium healthcare organization

title: Full-Stack Developer (AI-First, Rapid Build)
description:
Full-Stack Developer (AI-First, Rapid Build)

Remote | Contract



We’re a small, senior-team marketing and systems agency working with real estate investors, founders, and educators. We build fast, iterate constantly, and rely heavily on AI to design tools, workflows, and internal systems that give us leverage.



We’re looking for a full-stack developer who is deeply comfortable using AI as a daily building partner — not just for code generation, but for thinking, iteration, and speed.



This is not a “wait for specs, then build slowly” role. This is for someone who enjoys ambiguity, systems thinking, and shipping.



What You’ll Work On

-This role is a mix of web development and custom internal tools, including:

-Website & Frontend Work

-WordPress site builds (A–Z: structure, design, implementation)

-High-quality, conversion-focused marketing sites

-Rapid iteration using AI-assisted workflows

-Occasional non-WordPress builds (Next.js / Node.js or other modern stacks when appropriate)



Custom Tools & AI Systems

-Internal AI tools (e.g. custom copywriting engines based on proprietary processes)

-Client-facing portals (asset review, approvals, task visibility, ClickUp-synced workflows)

-Lightweight internal dashboards and utilities

-AI-driven automations and workflows

We care far more about speed, clarity, and leverage than over-engineering.



How We Work

-Small team, very little bureaucracy

-High trust, high responsibility

-Heavy use of AI (ChatGPT, APIs, automation tools)

-Build ? test ? iterate ? improve

You’ll often be given a goal, not a detailed spec



If you need perfectly defined requirements to start, this is not the role for you.



What We’re Looking For

You likely:

-Are a full-stack developer comfortable across frontend + backend

-Use AI daily to plan, write, debug, and iterate faster

-Can build clean WordPress sites quickly and confidently

-Are comfortable choosing tools pragmatically (not emotionally)

-Think in systems, workflows, and modular components

-Can explain your thinking clearly (not just ship code)



Bonus Skills

-Experience with automation tools (Zapier, Make, webhooks)

-Familiarity with AI APIs (OpenAI, etc.)

-Experience building internal tools or ops software

-Product or systems design instincts



Time & Compensation

-Contract role to start

-Project-based or part-time initially, $8-12/hr depending on experience and skills

-Opportunity to scale hours and move toward full-time

-Compensation based on experience and speed

We’re looking to start ASAP



Required Exercise (How We Evaluate Fit)

Instead of a traditional cover letter, we ask applicants to complete a short thinking exercise.



*The Challenge*

Please outline how you would design and approach a system like the following:

-A tool that takes structured inputs (project context, audience, constraints), generates copy using AI, runs that copy through multiple “AI reviewers” with different expert perspectives, scores and critiques each iteration, and automatically loops until a quality threshold is met—at which point it’s surfaced for human review and approval.



You do not need to write code.



In Your Response, Cover (High-Level):

System Architecture:

-How you’d break this into components

-What you’d build first vs later

AI Usage:

-Prompt structure

-Reviewer personas

-Scoring + iteration logic

Tooling Choices:

-What stack(s) you’d consider and why

-Where you’d leverage existing tools vs custom code

Iteration & Control:

-Preventing infinite loops or runaway costs

-Human review and override points

Speed vs Quality:

-What you’d keep simple in v1

-Where you’d intentionally move fast



Bullet points are fine. Diagrams optional.

There is no “correct” answer — we care about how you think.



How to Apply

Please submit:

-Your resume or portfolio (links welcome)

-Your response to the exercise above

If it looks like a strong fit, we’ll move quickly.

title: QA Tester
description:
Role Title: Offshore QA Tester

Team: QA / Engineering

Location: Offshore (with required overlap to U.S. Mountain/Central hours)

Type: Contractor

Reports To: QA Lead, with oversight from Product Manager and Technical Leads



Role Summary:



We are seeking an Offshore QA Tester to execute manual and regression testing across our multi-tenant SaaS platform. This role involves validating functionality, documenting reproducible issues, performing data integrity checks, and supporting QA documentation throughout our sprint and release cycles.



Candidates must bring strong manual QA skills, solid automation experience (in any tool), and the ability to ramp quickly into Cypress.



Responsibilities:



Execute manual and regression test cases across Regional and Hub tenants



Log reproducible bugs with clear, detailed documentation



Validate data integrity across Postgres (pgAdmin) and MongoDB



Re-test fixed tickets and maintain regression logs



Support QA documentation and provide test evidence



Participate in daily QA syncs and provide async updates



Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and QA teams to ensure high-quality releases



Required Skills & Tools:



2–4 years of experience in QA or software testing



Strong manual and regression testing experience for SaaS platforms



Hands-on experience with at least one QA automation tool (mandatory)



Selenium, Playwright, Cypress, Robot Framework, Katalon, etc.



Experience with:



ClickUp (or similar QA/ticketing tools)



Google Sheets for test data and reporting



Mailtrap (or similar
 testing tools)



Postgres (pgAdmin) and MongoDB for data validation



Chrome DevTools for debugging and validation



Strong written and verbal English communication



High attention to detail, accuracy, and consistency



Automation Expectations:



Familiarity with automation concepts: selectors, assertions, test structure, debugging



Ability to read, understand, and run automated tests



Ability to contribute to an existing regression automation suite



Willingness and ability to learn Cypress quickly during onboarding



Preferred Skills:



Exposure to Laravel, Vue.js, REST APIs, Postman



Experience testing multi-tenant SaaS systems



Understanding of compliance or data-sensitive environments



Success Metrics:



High-quality test execution and reproducible bug reporting



Timely completion of regression cycles



Clear test summaries and documentation



Reduction in missed defects during UAT



Proactive communication and collaboration with QA, Product, and Engineering

description:
Ready to be the voice of a team that actually cares?



Peninsula Insurance Services is growing fast, and we need a Receptionist who knows how to make every caller feel valued. You’ll be the first point of contact—managing calls, keeping things running smoothly, and making sure our agents can focus on what they do best. This isn’t just answering phones—it’s about creating an experience that sets us apart.

This is a career, not just a gig. If you thrive on solving problems, love delivering top-notch service, and want to be a key part of a team that’s making a real impact, we want to hear from you.

 messages

That’s impossible. That’s why we only hire great people—people who actually care, follow proven processes, and genuinely want to help clients get the protection they deserve.

Don't settle for just another job - be part of something bigger.



If you're ready to bring your A-game, make an impact, and join a team that actually values what you bring to the table, apply now. Let’s build something incredible together.

title: Knowledge Management Specialist
description:
Workstream is a mission-driven company building the all-in-one HR, payroll, and hiring platform for managing the hourly workforce. There are 2.7 billion hourly workers, making up 80% of the global workforce, but this market has been heavily underserved by technology and deserves better. Workstream has been purpose-built for the hourly workforce from day one so that these businesses and their employees can thrive.



Our customers include leading brands from multiple sectors, including Burger King, Carl's Jr./Hardee's, IHOP, KFC, and Culvers. We are a high growth series B company and quickly expanding our product portfolio to deliver on our vision. We are backed by legendary VCs and industry experts like Founders Fund, BOND, and Coatue.



Values



Here are our Company Values and we’d love to have individuals who can be a culture add to our team!



What We Offer



Permanently Remote

Pay wired directly to your bank account

$50 monthly Medical Stipend

Annual Bonus 

Performance-based bonuses

Flexible PTO

Enjoy company time off during some of the major PH and US Holidays

Career fast track for performers and internal mobility

Learn from a team of Stanford, MIT, Google and Harvard alumni

Grow With Us



We are looking for a Knowledge Management Specialist to help improve how we create, organize, and maintain documentation for both our customers and internal teams. This role will focus on making knowledge clear, customer-friendly, and easy to keep up to date as our products evolve.



You’ll work closely with Support, Product, and Engineering to ensure customers can quickly find answers and internal teams have reliable documentation to support them.



Day in the Life



-Rewrite and reorganize existing content to make it easier for customers to understand

-Create clear, practical documentation including written guides, product walkthroughs, videos, screenshots, and visual tutorials

-Translate technical and product documentation into simple, easy-to-follow guidance

-Use support ticket trends, customer feedback, and data insights to identify gaps and prioritize new content

-Review existing documentation regularly to keep content accurate and up to date

-Collaborate closely with Product, Engineering, and Support on feature launches, changes, and improvements

-Help manage and improve knowledge tools such as Intercom, Notion, internal wikis, help centers, video libraries, and AI-assisted knowledge tools

-Support internal documentation needs and help improve how teams use knowledge systems



Who You Are



-You have 1–3 years of experience creating user guides, help center articles, or other customer-facing documentation

-You have strong written English skills and enjoy writing clear, easy-to-understand content

-You are comfortable turning technical or complex information into practical guidance

-You have experience working with tools like Intercom, Notion, Salesforce, Zendesk, or similar platforms

-You are proactive, curious, and willing to dig in to find answers

-You work well with cross-functional teams and communicate clearly

-You are detail-oriented and take ownership of keeping content accurate and useful

-You are comfortable learning through experimentation and improving content over time

title: VSL Video Editor
description:
WE ARE LOOKING FOR SKILLED VSL VIDEO EDITORS



(VSL & UGC Focused)



Position Overview



Brand Bolt is seeking a specialized Video Sales Letter (VSL) Video Editor to join our growing team. This role is for someone who already understands VSL structure, pacing, and psychology—no major training required. If you’re highly creative, confident in your editing decisions, and know how to visually sell through video, we want to hear from you.



The ideal candidate has hands-on experience editing VSLs and UGC-style content, understands how to keep viewers engaged, and can elevate videos through smart visuals, clean graphics, and intentional color choices.



REQUIREMENTS

- Technical & Creative Expertise

- Proven experience editing VSLs (must understand VSL flow, hooks, retention, and conversions)

- Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro

- Experience with Adobe After Effects is a plus

- Familiarity with AI tools such as Descript, ElevenLabs, and Adobe Podcast

- Strong understanding of color science and color theory

- Ability to perform color correction and grading

- Comfortable editing 1080p–4K footage

- Knows how to repurpose content across platforms

- Basic graphic design skills (text layout, simple visuals, on-screen graphics)

- Knowledge of video compression, formats, and delivery specs

- Experience creating organized project files for collaborative workflows



PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES



- Highly creative editor with strong visual instincts

- Thrives in a fast-paced environment while maintaining high-quality output

- Strong attention to detail and ability to meet tight deadlines

- Excellent storytelling skills, especially for sales-driven content

- Clear communicator and receptive to feedback

- Able to understand and execute project briefs with minimal hand-holding

- Self-sufficient and proactive (no major training required)



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



- Edit and produce high-converting VSLs and UGC-style videos

- Apply creative editing techniques to improve engagement and retention

- Use graphics, text, pacing, and color intentionally to support the message

- Collaborate with the team to ensure alignment with brand goals and vision

title: Medical Biller - Cardiovascular (Remote)
description:
**Medical Biller – Advanced Cardiovascular Care PLLC**



Advanced Cardiovascular Care PLLC is seeking an experienced **Medical Biller** to join our cardiology practice. This role is **not entry-level** and requires **proven, hands-on experience** in cardiovascular billing.



**Key Requirements (Deal-Breakers):**



* **Extensive hands-on experience with eClinicalWorks (ECW)** – *required*

* **Direct cardiovascular / cardiology billing experience** – *required*

* Strong working knowledge of electronic medical records (EMR/EHR)

* High attention to detail with accurate claim handling and follow-through

* Clear and professional communication skills (written and verbal)



**Preferred / Strong Advantage:**



* Familiarity with **Florida medical insurance payers**, billing rules, and workflows

* Prior experience working in a **cardiology or specialty healthcare practice**



**Responsibilities:**



* Prepare, submit, and track medical insurance claims

* Post insurance payments and patient payments accurately

* Follow up on claim denials, rejections, and unpaid balances

* Manage and analyze accounts receivable (AR) reports

* Coordinate with insurance companies, patients, and clinic staff to resolve billing issues

* Ensure compliance with payer guidelines and internal billing procedures



This position requires someone who can work independently, manage billing priorities efficiently, and support a busy cardiology practice with accuracy and professionalism.

title: Benefits Account Manager
description:
Workstream is a mission-driven company building the all-in-one HR, payroll, and hiring platform for managing the hourly workforce. There are 2.7 billion hourly workers, making up 80% of the global workforce, but this market has been heavily underserved by technology and deserves better. Workstream has been purpose-built for the hourly workforce from day one so that these businesses and their employees can thrive.



Our customers include leading brands from multiple sectors, including Burger King, Carl's Jr./Hardee's, IHOP, KFC, and Culvers. We are a high growth series B company and quickly expanding our product portfolio to deliver on our vision. We are backed by legendary VCs and industry experts like Founders Fund, BOND, and Coatue.



Values



Here are our Company Values and we’d love to have individuals who can be a culture add to our team!



What We Offer



Permanently Remote

Pay wired directly to your bank account

$50 Monthly Stipend

Annual Bonus

Performance-based bonuses

Flexible PTO

Enjoy company time off during some of the major US and PH Holidays

Company-issued Device

Career fast track for performers and internal mobility

Learn from a team of Stanford, MIT, Google and Harvard alumni

Grow With Us



We’re looking for a full-time, dedicated, and dynamic Benefits Account Manager to join our team. In this role,  you will serve as a primary point of contact for your clients, managing their open enrollment and supporting their employee benefits administration needs. You’ll ensure compliance, accuracy, and top-tier service across payroll, benefits enrollments, deductions, and reporting. This is a client-facing role requiring both technical knowledge and strong relationship management skills to deliver a seamless Human Capital Management (HCM) experience.



Day in the Life



-Benefits Administration Support

-Support clients with employee benefit setup, open enrollment processes, eligibility tracking, and data accuracy.

-Ensure correct payroll deductions for medical, dental, vision, FSA/HSA, 401(k), and other benefits plans.

-Coordinate with carriers and internal WS teams to resolve issues related to eligibility files, COBRA, and enrollments.

-Assist clients with ACA compliance, including 1095-C/1094-C filings and measurement tracking.

-Troubleshoot and escalate technical issues related to benefits modules or integrations.

-Client Relationship Management

-Build strong relationships with clients through proactive outreach, consultative guidance, and consistent follow-up.

-Train and empower clients to use WS's benefits tools effectively.

-Monitor account health, identify upsell opportunities, and partner with internal sales teams to expand service usage.

-Maintain accurate documentation in CRM and case management systems.



Who You Are



-3+ years of experience in payroll, benefits administration, or HCM support (ADP platform experience preferred).

-Strong working knowledge of payroll processing, wage & hour laws, and benefits compliance (ACA, HIPAA, COBRA).

-Excellent communication and problem-solving skills with a passion for client service.

-Ability to manage multiple clients with varying levels of complexity.

-Experience with ADP platforms (Workforce Now, Vantage, RUN, etc.) is highly desirable.

-CPP, FPC, or CEBS certification is a plus.

-Bachelor’s degree in business, HR, accounting, or related field preferred

title: Workflow Engineer
description:
Workflow Engineer





Overview

We are looking for a Workflow Engineer to design, implement, and maintain the software systems that support our operations. This role focuses on improving productivity through better tools, smarter configurations, and clear, well-functioning workflows. You will collaborate with leadership and tea
mbers to understand needs, eliminate inefficiencies, and create systems that scale as the company grows.



Key Responsibilities



Software and Systems Analysis



• Audit all current software platforms and identify gaps, redundancies, and inefficiencies

• Evaluate team workflows to determine where tools are underutilized or misaligned

• Create clear recommendations for improvement based on business needs



Tool Selection and Implementation



• Research and recommend new tools that increase operational productivity

• Lead the setup and configuration of new software

• Build integrations between platforms to reduce manual steps and prevent errors

• Configure automations, workflows, access controls, and permissions



Workflow Optimization



• Translate existing business processes into streamlined digital workflows

• Build systems that support repeatable, scalable operations

• Document configurations and workflow logic for ongoing reference



Team Training and Adoption



• Train tea
mbers on new tools, workflows, and best practices

• Provide clear guidance to ensure proper usage of software across roles

• Create reference materials that support strong adoption and reduce knowledge gaps



Continuous Improvement



• Monitor system performance and user behavior to identify improvement opportunities

• Adjust workflows as business needs evolve

• Stay current on new features, emerging tools, and best practices in workflow automation



What Success Looks Like



• Teams use software consistently and correctly

• Manual tasks are reduced through well-designed automations

• Workflows run smoothly with fewer errors, delays, or handoff issues

• The company operates with clear, documented systems that scale cleanly

• Tools support growth rather than slow it down



Qualifications



• Experience configuring or administering business software systems

• Strong understanding of workflow design, automation, and integration concepts

• Ability to evaluate tools and match them to operational needs

• Comfortable learning new platforms quickly

• Strong communication skills and the ability to explain technical concepts clearly

• Proven ability to collaborate across departments



Preferred Skills



• Experience with workflow or automation tools such as Zapier, Make, Power Automate, or similar

• Familiarity with project management or operations platforms such as ClickUp, Monday, or Asana

• Ability to map processes visually using flowchart tools

• Strong problem solving and systems thinking ability



Ideal Candidate Traits



• Enjoys building order from complexity

• Curious and resourceful in finding the best tools for the job

• Strong attention to detail and quality

• Comfortable running training sessions and supporting user adoption

• Thinks in systems and understands how tools and people interact

title: Social Media Specialist (Remote) – Long-Term, High Accountability
description:
Job type: Full-time

Schedule: Sunday–Thursday 9:00 AM–7:00 PM, Friday until 2:00 PM (your local time)

Off: Saturday + Jewish holidays

Pay: $3/hr for first 2 months, then $4/hr (performance-based increase)

Payroll: Biweekly on Mondays

Tools: Microsoft Teams + WhatsApp, ClickUp

Monitoring: Teramind during work hours



Role Summary

We are hiring a professional Social Media Specialist who understands strategy, platform best practices, and execution. This is not a “post random content” role. We need someone who can plan, create, publish, analyze, and improve results consistently.



Platforms (must be familiar)



Instagram (Reels, Stories, posts, highlights, engagement)



TikTok (short-form, trends, hooks, retention)



 (pages, groups, short video, link posts)



YouTube Shorts (repurposing + optimization)



Optional plus: LinkedIn, X/Twitter (if relevant)



Core Responsibilities



Build and manage a weekly/monthly content calendar (themes, campaigns, posting cadence)



Research trends, competitors, and content angles; propose weekly ideas proactively



Write strong captions with hooks, CTAs, and brand voice consistency



Create/post short-form content concepts (Reels/TikTok/Shorts): scripts, hooks, shot list, captions



Design clean creatives in Canva (or similar) for posts, carousels, stories



Schedule posts using approved tools and ensure everything is posted on time



Community management: respond to comments/DMs professionally, escalate issues when needed



Basic brand management: keep content consistent (tone, visuals, messaging)



Run weekly performance reporting: reach, engagement, watch time, saves, shares, clicks, follower growth



Improve based on data: what worked, what didn’t, next week’s plan



Required Knowledge / Skills (serious)



Strong understanding of:



Algorithm basics and retention (especially for Reels/TikTok/Shorts)



Hooks, pacing, captions/subtitles, and CTAs



Hashtags/keywords: when to use, how to optimize, what to avoid



Posting cadence and best times (and testing to confirm)



Engagement strategy: comments, DMs, community growth



Knows how to create:



Carousels that educate/sell



Reels/TikToks that hold attention (hook ? value ? CTA)



Stories that drive clicks and replies



Basic editing capability (any of these is fine):



CapCut / InShot / Premiere Rush / native platform tools



Can follow direction but also bring ideas without being micromanaged



Excellent written English (clean, confident, professional)



Organized and reliable: deadlines matter



Nice to Have



Experience with paid ads is a plus (not required)



Experience with UGC-style content and scripting



Experience building a brand voice guide and content pillars



To Apply (REQUIRED — applications without these will be ignored)



60–90 second intro video (link)



Portfolio/samples: links to accounts you managed + 5–10 examples of posts/videos you created



Short explanation: how you d
 what to post each week (your process)



Confirm you can work: Sun–Thu 9–7, Fri until 2, Sat off + Jewish holidays



Confirm you’re okay with Teramind monitoring during work hours



Internet speed + PC specs
